That's a great plan! Test driving both cars will give you a hands-on feel for which one suits you better. Pay attention to how comfortable you are behind the wheel, how easy it is to navigate the controls, and how well the car handles on the road.

And don't forget to check the safety ratings and fuel efficiency of each model. Those are crucial factors to consider when making a decision. You can find this information on the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) website and the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) website, respectively.

Additionally, you can also read reviews from reputable sources such as Edmunds, Kelley Blue Book, and Consumer Reports to get a better understanding of each car's strengths and weaknesses.

Remember, buying a car is a personal decision, and what works for someone else might not work for you. Take your time, do your research, and trust your instincts.

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. Good luck with your car search, and I hope you find the perfect ride for you!
